block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC
ALBERT MUSIC HALL Ladies of Country and Bluegrass Music Show. Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $4; $1 for children under 12. 125 Wells Mills Road, Waretown. (609) 971-1593.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC
ALBERT MUSIC HALL Ladies of Country and Bluegrass Music Show. Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $4; $1 for children under 12. 125 Wells Mills Road, Waretown. (609) 971-1593.

CAPE MAY CONVENTION HALL Cape May Music Festival. Through next Sunday. The Butch Thompson Trio. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Ahmad Jamal, pianist-composer, present jazz spectacular. Saturday at 6:30 p.m. at Brighton Park, Atlantic City or next Sunday at 8 p.m. at the Cape May Convention Hall. Beach Drive and Stockton Street, Cape May. Morning Star, Irish music. Thursday at 8 p.m. Our Lady Star of the Sea Church, Cape May. Tickets: $20 for each concert; $10 for older people; $5 for students. (609) 884-5404.

JOHN HARMS CENTER FOR THE ARTS The JVC Jazz Festival, featuring Max Roach, host; Richard Bona, bassist; and Dianne Reeves, vocalist. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $38, $36, $28 and $18. 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-3600.

J. C. C. THURNAUER SCHOOL OF MUSIC ''Keyboard Collaborations: Classical and Jazz Piano,'' with Cathy Campbell and Bob Rodriguez. Today at 4:30 p.m. Donations accepted. Eric Brown Theater, 411 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 569-7900, extension 235.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER Philharmonic Orchestra of New Jersey, featuring Nadja Salerno-Sonnenberg, violinst. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Prudential Hall. Tickets: $8 to $40. ''Absolut Sounds of the City 2000,'' outdoor music series. Thursday evenings through Aug. 31. Flipside, jazz; Naranja, latin alternative rock; Sabor Brazil, samba and bossa nova; and Tribe of Djembe, reggae and African rhythms. Thursday, 5 p.m. to 10 p.m. Theater Square. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.

OCEAN GROVE SUMMER CONCERT SERIES Through Sept. 9. The Brooklyn Tabernacle Choir and Phillips, Craig and Dean. Saturday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $25 (reserved); $20 (regular admission). The Great Auditorium, at the intersection of Pilgrim and Ocean Pathways, Ocean Grove. (732) 988-0645.

PNC BANK ARTS CENTER 311. Today at 7 p.m. Tickets: $25. No Doubt, along with Lit and Black Eyed Peas. Tuesday. Tickets: $27.50. The Allman Brothers Band, along with Hot Tuna. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $26.50 and $46.50. Exit 116, off the Garden State Parkway, Holmdel. (201) 507-8900.
PRINCETON UNIVERSITY RICHARDSON AUDITORIUM 2000 Princeton University Summer Concerts series, featuring Miro String Quartet. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Free. Alexander Hall, Princeton. (609) 258-5000.
STOCKTON PERFORMING ARTS CENTER Bay Atlantic Symphony with Hilary Hahn, violinist. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20. Jim Leeds Road, Pomona. (609) 652-4527.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

ABC GALLERY ''Nature's Mysteries, Oils by Edith Skiba.'' Through July 1. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Fridays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Lambertville Public Library, 6 Lilly Street, Lambertville. (609) 397-0275.

CERULEAN FINE ARTS GALLERY ''New Works,'' a summer membership show, with paintings in all media, sculpture and photography. Through Sept. 2. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11:30 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, 4 to 9 p.m. Headquarters Plaza Mall, Speedwell Avenue (Route 202), Morristown. (973) 267-3730.

CIVILIAN ''Val Sivilli: Paintings.'' Through July 15. Hours: Mondays and Wednesdays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. 10 Bridge Street, Frenchtown. (908) 996-7279.

COOPER GALLERY ''The Illuminated Woman,'' an exhibition of paintings and drawings by Eileen Kennedy-Dyne. Through July 1. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, noon to 7 p.m. 295 Grove Street, Jersey City. (201) 451-1074.

DIVIANA ''Whimsy and Magic,'' a gala art show of handcrafted wall hangings by Mariette Van Hees-Theeuwes of Randolph, a Dutch-born artist. Through June. Hours: Monday through Friday, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturday, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 1225 Sussex Turnpike, Randolph. (973) 895-2661.

EXTENSION GALLERY Joseph W. Acquah's ''Dream Fulfilled, to God Be the Glory.'' Through June 29. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; other times by appointment. 60 Ward Avenue Extension, Mercerville. (609) 890-7777.

GROUNDS FOR SCULPTURE ''Spring Exhibition'' featuring Red Grooms: sculpture; Bill Barrett: sculpture and painting; and Andrzej Pitynski: partisans. Through July 2. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Tuesday and Wednesday by appointment. 18 Fairgrounds Road, Hamilton Township. (609) 586-0616.
KESSLER INSTITUTE FOR REHABILITATION ''Walter Engel: Healing Wheels.'' Through July 15. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. 1199 Pleasant Valley Way, West Orange. (973) 243-6895.

MACCULLOCH HALL HISTORICAL MUSEUM ''Woven Into Words: Coverlets in America.'' Through Aug. 13. Admission: $3; $2 for older people and students. Hours: Wednesdays, Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. 45 Macculloch Avenue, Morristown. (973) 538-2404.

MONMOUTH MUSEUM ''New Jersey's Pinelands: Water in the Balance.'' Through Sept. 3. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $4. 761 Newman Springs Road, Lincroft. (732) 747-2266.

MONTCLAIR ART MUSEUM ''Croquet: The Art of Play,'' interactive outdoor exhibit. Saturday through Oct. 15. Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 7 p.m.; Sept. 9 through Oct. 15, course will be open Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Admission: $7; $4 for children. ''Untamed Spirits: Animal Imagery in Native American Art.'' Through July 30. Will Barnet: A Timeless World. Through Aug. 20. Hours: Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $5; $4 for older people and students; free for members and children under 12. 3 South Mountain Avenue, Montclair. (973) 746-5555.

MONTCLAIR STATE UNIVERSITY David Cole: Recent Work and In Gathering of Paint Stirrers. Through July 21. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. University Gallery, Life Hall, Valley Road and Normal Avenue, Upper Montclair. (973) 655-7640.

MORRIS MUSEUM ''Ice Age,'' featuring casts of mammals from the Pleistocene epoch. Through today. ''Contemporary Paintings from The Morris Museum Collection.'' Saturday through July 24. Hours: Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays to 8 p.m. Admission: $5; $3 for older people and children under age 3. 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-0454.

NEW JERSEY HISTORICAL SOCIETY ''History's Mysteries,'' interactive exhibition. Through July. ''Dining In, Dining Out,'' featuring photographs, video clips, rare silverware, period furniture and 18th-century cookbooks. Through summer, 2001. ''Pride of Newark: Baseball's Bears and Eagles,'' about the history of baseball in Newark. Through Summer 2001. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 52 Park Place, Newark. (973) 596-8500.

NEW JERSEY STATE MUSEUM ''Forgotten Gateway: The Abandoned Building of Ellis Island,'' photographs by Larry Racioppo. Through June 30. ''Building a Collection: Fine Art at the New Jersey State Museum.'' Through Aug. 20. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 4:45 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Free. 205 West State Street, Trenton. (609) 292-6464.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''The Art of Ink in American 2000: International Contemporary Calligraphy.'' Through July 9. ''Year of the Dragon: The Calligraphy of Wang Fangyu.'' Through Nov. 12. ''From Tabletop to TV Tray: China and Glass in America, 1880-1980.'' Through today. ''Needless Necessity: Jewelry, Silver and Personal Meaning.'' Through December. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.; Thursdays (after hours) until 8:30 p.m. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6550.

PRINCETON UNIVERSITY ART MUSEUM ''The Dawn of Maya Kings: An Early Maya Stela.'' Through July 30. Photographs by Barbara Bosworth. Through Sept. 3. ''A Window Into Collecting American Folk Art: The Edward Duff Balken Collection.'' Through today. ''Flora and Fauna in Chinese Painting.'' Through July 30. Yayoi Kusama: Early Drawings From the Collection of Richard Castellane. Through July 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Princeton campus. (609) 258-3788.

SOMERSET ART ASSOCIATION ''Reflections,'' works by William Nagengast, and ''Earth Prints,'' clay reliefs transformed into works on paper by Sy Shames. Through July 13. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 9:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 2 p.m.; Saturdays, 9:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m.. 2020 Burnt Mills Road, Bedminster. (908) 234-2345.

SWAIN GALLERIES ''Fruit, Florals and Flourishes.'' Through June 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Saturdays, 9:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. 703 Watchung Avenue, Plainfield. (908) 756-1707.

WHEATON VILLAGE ''American Glass: 1900-2000,'' featuring more than 100 industrial and decorative pieces. Through Oct. 22. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $7; $6 for older people; $3.50 for students. ''HER,'' multi-media exhibit. Saturday through Aug. 13. No admission charge to The Gallery of American Craft. Exit 26, Route 55, Millville. (800) 998-4552, extension 2756.
THEATER
DOVER LITTLE THEATER Gilbert and Sullivan's ''Pirates of Penzance.'' Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $16. Elliot Street, Dover. (973) 328-9202.

HUNTERDON HILLS PLAYHOUSE ''Mary, Mary,'' Jean Kerr's comedy. Through June 30. Monday through Saturday luncheon performances at 11 a.m., $35.50 and $39.50; Saturdays at 6:30 p.m., $43 and $47; Sundays at 3:30 p.m., $41.50 and $45.50. Reservations required. Exit 12 off Routes 78 and 22, Perryville. (800) 447-7313.
KASSCHAU MEMORIAL SHELL Irine Fokine Ballet. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. Free. Veterans Field, Maple Avenue, Ridgewood. (201) 444-1776.

KEAN COLLEGE Alliance Repertory presents ''Dancing at Lughnasa,'' Brian Friel's Irish play. Through Saturday. Thursday, Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m.; today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $15; $10 for students and older people. Little Theater, 1000 Morris Avenue, Union. (908) 527-2000 or (908) 756-7824.

LEONIA PLAYERS' GUILD ''The Crucible'' by Henry Miller. Friday through July 9. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12 for students and older people. Civil War Drill Hall Theater, 130 Grand Avenue at Oakdene Avenue, Leonia. Wood Park, Fort Lee Road off Broad Avenue, Leonia. (201) 947-9606.

McCARTER THEATER Opera Festival of New Jersey. Through July 23. ''Falstaff.'' Saturday (opening) at 8 p.m.; Wednesday, June 28 at 7:30 p.m.; Friday June 30 at 8 p.m.; Sunday, July 9 at 2 p.m.; Saturday July 15 at 8 p.m. ''Carmen.'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m.; Friday at 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 2 p.m.; Saturday, July 1 at 8 p.m.; Saturday, July 8 at 8 p.m.; Friday, July 14 at 8 p.m. Tickets: $22 to $82. Center for the Performing Arts, 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 258-2787.

MONTCLAIR STATE UNIVERSITY TheaterFest, the Professional Equity Theatre-in-Residence. Through August. ''Master Class,'' starring Leslie Uggams. Today at 3 p.m.; Wednesday at 2 p.m. and 8 p.m.; Thursday through Saturday at 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $35; $28 for older people. Valley Road and Normal Avenue, Upper Montclair. (973) 655-5112.
NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER The Who's ''Tommy.'' Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $12 to $58. Prudential Hall. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
NEW JERSEY REPERTORY COMPANY ''Octet,'' Mark Dunn comic-drama. Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $25. Lumia Theater, 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732) 229-3166.

NEW JERSEY SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL ''The Forest,'' by Alexander Ostrovsky, Russian playwright. Through July 2. Today at 2 p.m. and 7 p.m.; Tuesday and Wednesday at 8 p.m.; Thursday at 7:30 p.m.; Friday at 8 p.m.; Saturday at 2 p.m. and 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 2 p.m. and 7 p.m. Tickets: $21 to $38. F. M. Kirby Shakespeare Theater, 36 Madison Avenue, Madison. (973) 408-5600.

PAPER MILL PLAYHOUSE ''Pippin.'' Through July 23. Wednesdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 7:30 p.m.; Thursday and Sunday matinees at 2 p.m.; Saturday matinees at 2:30 p.m. Tickets: $36 to $60. Brookside Drive, Millburn. (973) 376-4343.
FOR CHILDREN
MORRIS COUNTY PARK COMMISSION ''Butterflies,'' presentation and discussion. Saturday at 2 p.m. Free. Great Swamp Outdoor Education Center, 247 Southern Boulevard, Chatham Township. (973) 635-6629.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''Where in the Universe Is Carmen Sandiego?'' at the Alice and Leonard Dreyfuss Planetarium. Through October. Saturdays and Sundays, 1 p.m. and 3 p.m. Tickets: $3; $2 for members; $1 for children and older people. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6355.

PEQUEST TROUT HATCHERY AND NATURAL RESOURCE EDUCATION CENTER Fly Casting Clinic for Beginners. Saturday at noon. Registration is required. Route 46 (nine miles west of Hackettstown), Oxford. (908) 637-4125.

STONY BROOK-MILLSTONE WATERSHED ''Bats at Dusk'' program for families. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Free. ''Nature Photography Trip: Pine Barrens Flora'' for adults and high school students. Saturday, 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. Fee: $25. ''White Water Rafting on the Lehigh River Gorge.'' Saturday, 7:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. Cost: $80; $70 for children 8 to 12 years old. Pre-registration is required. Buttinger Nature Center, 31 Titus Mill Road, Pennington. (609) 737-7592.

WALT WHITMAN CULTURAL ARTS CENTER Fun Summer Fridays, through Aug. 25. The Steel Source Band. Friday, 10:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Free; donations accepted. Johnson Park at Second and Copper Streets, Camden. (856) 964-8300.
SPOKEN WORD

BARNES & NOBLE Mark Di Ionno, author, will discuss and sign his book, ''Revolutionary War Trail for Families and History Buffs.'' Thursday at 7 p.m. Tom Breiding, Nashville songwriter, will celebrate the fourth release of ''Happy Hour in the Round Hotel.'' Saturday at 2 p.m. Free. 44 Brick Plaza, Brick. (732) 255-5914.

BARNES & NOBLE Theordore R. Riddle, creator and artist of the comic book ''Compu-M.E.C.H. A Hero for a New Age,'' will discuss and sign his book. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Donald Friedman, author, will discuss and sign his book ''The Hand Before the Eye.'' Thursday at 7:30 p.m. 518 West Mount Pleasant Avenue, Livingston. (973) 535-9087.

BARNES & NOBLE Joseph M. Soll, author, will discuss and sign his book ''Adoption Healting . . . A Path to Recovery.'' Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Sadie Penzato, author, will discuss and sign her book ''Growing Up Sicilian and Female.'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. 160 Route 17 North, Paramus. (201) 261-6995.

BOOKENDS BOOKSTORE Stephen Horn, a former federal prosecutor in the Justice Department's civil rights division, will discuss and sign his book, ''In Her Defense.'' Wednesday at 7 p.m. 232 East Ridgewood Avenue, Ridgewood. (201) 445-0726.

BLACK MARIA FILM FESTIVAL Annual tour presenting the winning works of independent filmmakers. Saturday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $6. Long Beach Island Foundation of the Arts and Sciences, 120 Long Beach Boulevard, Loveladies. (609) 494-1241, ext. 300.

PATHMARK MULTICULTURAL ARTS FESTIVAL 2000 Elvis Classe and Su Banda Loca. Saturday, 1 p.m. to 6 p.m. St. John's Cathedral, DeGrasse Street, Paterson. Next Sunday, 12:30 p.m. to 6 p.m., St. Rose of Lima Church, Gray Street, between West Market and Orange Streets, Newark. Free. (888) 486-4656.
SOMERSET COUNTY PARK COMMISSION Father's Day Horseback Ride. Today, 11 a.m. to noon. Cost: $25. Visitor Center, 11 Layton Road, Far Hills. (908) 766-5955.
SPRING FINE ART AND CRAFTS AT BROOKDALE PARK SHOW Juried fine art and crafts show. Today, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Free. Bellvue and Grove Avenues, Watchung. (908) 874-5247.

WEIS ECOLOGY CENTER Father's Day Family Nature Hike. Today, 1 p.m. to 3:30 p.m. Fee: $5. Whale Watch Trip to Plymouth, Mass. Saturday, 7:30 a.m. to 12:30 a.m. Fee: $65. Pre-registration required. 150 Snake Den Road, Ringwood. (973) 835-2160.
AT THE CASINOS
All tickets are available through Ticketmaster, (800) 736-1420.

BALLY'S PARK PLACE Charlie Prose presents ''Lookin' at Life.'' Tuesday through Thursday at 3:30 p.m. Main Ballroom. Tickets: $22.50. ''Legends in Concert,'' impersonations of Stevie Wonder, Little Richard, Elvis Presley, Linda Ronstadt and Barbara Streisand. Mondays through Thursdays at 3:30 and 7:30 p.m.; Saturdays at 8 and 10:30 p.m.; Sundays at 7:30 and 10 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $25. Park Cabaret, Boardwalk and Park Place. (800) 225-5977.
RESORTS CASINO HOTEL Steve Giordano, jazz guitarist. Friday and Saturday, 9 p.m. to 1:40 a.m. Lounge at Asian Spice. 1133 Boardwalk. (888) 771-1786.

SANDS HOTEL AND CASINO Dane Anthony and the Sons of Thunder. Friday and Saturday, 10:15 p.m to 2:15 a.m. Copa Lounge. Free. Beijing Opera. Friday at 10 p.m.; Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $28, $48 and $68. Indiana Avenue and Brighton Park. (609) 441-4137.

TROPICANA Tanya Tucker with Ty Herndon. Friday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $47.50 and $37.50. ''Titanic: The Return,'' all new exhibit with over 250 artifacts. Tuesday through Sept. 9. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. Tickets: $14.95; $6.95 for children, ages 5 to 11. Grand Exhibition Center, fourth floor, South Tower. Boardwalk and Brighton Avenue. (609) 340-4020.

TRUMP MARINA Kenny Wayne Shephard. Friday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $30 and $40. Stone Temple Pilots. Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $40. Third World, Inner Circle and Junior Marvin. Next Sunday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $30. Grand Cayman. Huron Avenue and Brigantine Boulevard. (800) 777-8477.

TRUMP TAJ MAHAL Kenny Rogers. Today at 8 p.m. Tickets: $35 and $45. Mark G. Etess Arena. ''Lit,'' rock. Friday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $18. Xanadu. Allman Brothers. Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $60. 1000 Boardwalk, at Virginia Avenue. (609) 449-1000.

ON THE TOWNS Correction: June 22, 2000, Thursday The caption with a picture of the singer Dianne Reeves in the New Jersey section on Sunday omitted information about her performance. Ms. Reeves will be performing at 8 p.m. tomorrow at the John Harms Center for the Performing Arts in Englewood, N.J. Ticket information is available at (201) 567-3600. The band Lit, referred to in the caption, will indeed appear at 10 p.m. tomorrow at the Trump Taj Mahal in Atlantic City. Ticket information is available at (609) 449-1000.
Correction: June 22, 2000, Thursday

The caption with a picture of the singer Dianne Reeves in the New Jersey section on Sunday omitted information about her performance. Ms. Reeves will be performing at 8 p.m. tomorrow at the John Harms Center for the Performing Arts in Englewood, N.J. Ticket information is available at (201) 567-3600. The band Lit, referred to in the caption, will indeed appear at 10 p.m. tomorrow at the Trump Taj Mahal in Atlantic City. Ticket information is available at (609) 449-1000.
